title: Is it actually bannable? 'gg ez'
body:
I've seen a couple streamers saying 'gg ez' 'gg ez af' etc. I ain't no snitch and don't want them to get banned etc, but my question is, is it actually bannable? I see chat spamming 'BANNED' etc. Say if you were to not talk all game and simply say 'gg ez', is it possible for a perma ban? Would really like if a Riot employee could answer, would be more 'convinced'?

Note: I know its toxic bla bla, i've said it before, people have said it to me. Personally I don't think it's that toxic, maybe a bit unsportsmanlike.

replies.body:
It's fine to have "gay", "%%%", etc in your club name, but "gg ez" is considered bad, lmao.

[edit] The moderated word was a bundle of sticks.
Not bannable but annoying as fuck
If anyone is offended by "GG EZ", then their skin must be thinner than rice paper.
have you played on OCE before? everyone is soft

I mean, it's effectively you taunting the other player and going against the summoner code of being "sportsmanlike". So yes, I can see why it's bannable.

Also, it would be nice if people got more creative with their end game banter rather than "gg ez".
being negative no matter the wording is what is punishable, let's rephrase the question, is being a jerk in a competitive environment acceptable?

Ive seen a Rioter say that it was a 'reportable' offence. 
Wether or not that translates into a ban, I don't know.

Personally I think that it being a reportable offence is the bridge too far, it's annoying and makes you look pathetic when you say it. Yea its not nice, but it also makes you look pretty pathetic when you get deeply offended by it.

Some people are bad losers, or bad winners, if you took away all those people, league probably wouldn't have enough players to survive.
I for one would rather have a few bad eggs in the bunch, 
than not actually have the bunch at all.

>Personally I think that it being a reportable offence is the bridge too far

I mean, usually it's said by the tosser that was being a tosser in team chat, which i think comes into it.

Its something you wouldnt say when your shaking hands at the end of a sport.  In my country someone would probably knock you out. Its just bad manners, cos you think your tuff behind a computer screen. Worst thing is when its a  close game and somwone mouths off thinkong they are gos when usually they got carried. The humble ones who dont say anything are usually the carriers as well lol.

I mean if the person carried their team and won, I don't usually have an issue. The only time it's annoying is when you were like 3-0 vs enemy top, and their jungler camps you and they win, but their top laner is still 0-10 and then he is the one to say gg ez. That shit tilts me. Idk about you but in Australia when I used to play footy, when we would win we would say 'gg get shit on kids' and when we lost we would cop the same. It's just banter, usually people that can't handle it are people that would get mad at a joke about them aswell.

Yeah its a bit different here, most people are humble and shit on others who gloat.

 We also have tall poppy syndrome here which is quite bad as well. We always highlight the bad points in someone over what they did well, but in saying that its changing.

It's considered negative (assuming it's not used as a meme by the losing team) but as far as punishments go it would never see you punished on it's own.
